column80: Your "yet" is a bit leading. These are not really languages. They are frameworks. We build a framework as a natural part of coding anything. Or rather we build engines and when it works well enough to share with the community, we call it a framework. When the community demands it a lot, then we try to find funding to ensure it stays alive. Quantum products are still pretty speculative right now. BUT, companies are desperate for talent. They need people to learn this stuff in small and big ways and everything in between. How they learn it and what framework they use is unimportant.
